source_file: Fadl et al. - 2021 - Minute Pulmonary Meningothelial-like Nodules.pdf

evidence.exact_quote: A 63-year-old woman was referred for dedicated chest CT imaging

evidence.extracted_value: Incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules during abdominal CT for diarrhea
evidence.exact_quote: incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules at an abdominal CT scan performed for evaluation of diarrhea
Right lower lobe transbronchial cryobiopsy histopathologic findings

evidence.extracted_value: Numerous small (< 6 mm), rounded, ground-glass, randomly distributed nodules with no lobe spared. Some nodules showed central lucencies with a ringlike appearance
evidence.exact_quote: Chest CT showed numerous small ( , 6 mm), rounded, ground-glass, randomly distributed nodules with no lobe spared. Some nodules  showed  central  lucencies  with  a  ringlike  appearance

evidence.extracted_value: Nodular cellular proliferation expanding the interstitium with whorllike appearance
evidence.exact_quote: nodular cellular proliferation  expanding  the  interstitium  with  whorllike  appearance

evidence.extracted_value: Positive staining for epithelial membrane antigen and progesterone receptor, negative staining for neuroendocrine markers such as synaptophysin
evidence.exact_quote: Immunohistochemistry  with positive staining for epithelial membrane antigen and progesterone receptor, but negative staining for neuroendocrine markers such as synaptophysin
abdominal CT scan performed for evaluation of diarrhea
